item.title: Creating a webpage with Hugo & Publishing it with Github Pages.
item.description: From downloading Hugo to deploying to github pages. Install hugo using homebrew. brew install hugo Download hugo theme “PaperMod”. hugo new site (myreponame).github.io cd (myreponame).github.io git init. # init git repo. Create config.yml PaperMod recommends using yml rather than toml. Add this line to config.yml theme: "PaperMod" Create workflow file .github/workflows/gh-pages.yml (Ref) Push local repo to remote repo at github git remote add origin https://github.com/(MyGitHubAccount)/(RepoName).git git branch -M main git push -u origin main The homepage will be buit & deployed with GitHub Actions.

Publications 2023 Y. Iwatani, H. Asada, C.-A. Yeh, K. Taira, and S. Kawai, “Identifying the self-sustaining mechanisms of transonic airfoil buffet with resolvent analysis,” AIAA Journal, 61 (6), 2400-2411, (2023). 2022 Y. Iwatani, H. Asada, and S. Kawai, “POD, DMD, and resolvent analysis of transonic airfoil buffet”, AIAA SCITECH 2022 Forum, 2022-0461, (2022) Conference talks 2024 Y. Iwatani and S. Kawai, “Nonlinear flow dynamics and skin friction in heated and cooled transitional boundary layers” “, 38th CFD symposium, Tokyo, Japan, Dec, 2024 C.
